avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow is in the region. Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after SW-snow showers and strong winds.Ongoing snow showers in the next days further encourage wind slab and cornice formation on N- and E- aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow is covering the region after persistens strong SW- snow fall in the last days. Wind slabs have formed on N- and E- facing aspects and unstable wind slabs are widespread. Ongoing snow fall and SW winds will continue forming wind slabs and cornices in the mountains in the next days. Little snow is underneath the new snow in most places and people traveling in the mountains should be careful of rocks underneath the wind slab.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Most in South- and West-Iceland. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snow fall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á sunnudagskvöld bætir í vind og vestan 10-15 yfir nóttina. Suðlæg átt 10-15 og slydduél á láglendi á mánudag, en heldur hægari vindur og samfelld snjókoma um tíma seinnipartinn. Hiti í kringum frostmark.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has been added in snow showers and snowdrift in variable southerly winds the last days. Unstable wind slabs can have built up in mountains, especially in gullies and slopes facing W-N-E. Continuing similar weather in the forecast, and avalanche danger is expected to increase gradually.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind, especially SW. Before, there was little snow in the area. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. Now there is considerable new snow in the area and continuing snow showers in variable southerly winds are forecasted. Wind slabs are expected to have formed and should continue to build up the next days, especially in gullies, depressions and slopes facing W-N-E.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Most in South- and West-Iceland. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snow fall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi éljagangur næstu daga í breytilegum suðlægum áttum, samfelldari snjókoma á mánudagskvöld. Ekki mjög efnismikil él en skafrenningur getur valdið hraðari snjósöfnun í gil, lægðir og hléhlíðar.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches released in the region during last week"s thaw on various aspects. A small avalanche released close to the Siglufjarðarvegur road by Landsendi. Last week, avalanches were reported on Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur in Karlsárdalur and four in Bustarbrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed on N- and E- aspects during strong SW-winds and some snow showers. Ongoing SW directions and snow showers in the next days continue wind slab  and cornice formation. Warming and thawing earlier this week has strengthened the snow pack up to 1000 m.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are widespread in the mountains after persistent SW snow showers in the last days. Ongoing snowfall and southwesterlies continue encouraging wind slab formation. Significant warming and thaw last Wednesday and Thursday has penetrated and strengthened the snowpack. All snow sensors show a uniform, isothermal snowpack under 1000 m but weakness may still be present in the snowpack above. However, the snowpack is likely to have strengthened in all elevations during this warming and subsequent freezing.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Most in South- and West-Iceland. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snow fall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðvestan 13-18 um tíma við sjóinn á sunnudagskvöld. Stöku él uppúr hádegi á mánudag en bætir í ofankomu er líður á daginn.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few sluff were seen in Skriðfell and Snjófell in of Norðfjörður on Saturday, 27.1. A small wet sluff released above Neskaupstaður in the thaw on Thursday, 25.1.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow that has fallen since Thursday has drifted in SW and S winds and formed new thin wind slabs, which may be unstable. Older snow mostly became homogeneous, isothermal and stable after the thaw on Thursday. On Monday, snow should get moist and subside in the lower part of slopes. Higher up, wind slab formation should continue. Wet sluffs might release where it rains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Last week there were wind slabs on top of hardpacked snow and a weak layer with facets between. In warm weather and rain on Thursday, snow subsided and became homogeneous and isothermal up to high elevations. Temperatures went over 0°C for a time up to ca 1000 m elevation. In the highest mountains, old weaknesses may still exist. Since Thursday, a bit more snow has been added and new thin wind slabs can have formed where snow accumulates, especially in NW-E aspects, gullies and depressions. On Monday, snow should get moist on the lower parts of slopes but above around 500 m elevation, more snow is forecasted to add and drift in SW winds. High in mountains, further wind slab formation is therefore expected.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Most in South- and West-Iceland. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snow fall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma og SV-skafrenningur til fjalla seinnipart mánudags en hlýnar aðeins með rigningu í neðri hluta hlíða, upp í um 500 m hæð. Úrkoman á einkum að vera á sunnanverðu spásvæðinu. Kólnar aftur á þriðjudag, eftir það þurrt að mestu og fremur hægar suðlægar áttir.
